meanings.definition: Exclusives: Items or products that are only available to a select group of people.
meanings.sent1: The store had exclusives that only VIP customers could buy.
meanings.sent2: The exclusives in the boutique were limited edition sneakers.
meanings.sent3: The exclusives were so fancy that even the mannequins seemed impressed.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of exclusives was like a treasure trove hidden from the world.
meanings.sent5: The exclusives sparkled on the shelves, tempting passersby to peek inside.

meanings.definition: Exclusives: News or information that is only given to a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: The journalist shared exclusives with her editor before publishing.
meanings.sent2: The exclusives about the new movie spread quickly among fans.
meanings.sent3: The exclusives were so juicy that even the walls seemed to lean in to listen.
meanings.sent4: His exclusives were like hidden gems waiting to be discovered by the right audience.
meanings.sent5: The exclusives whispered secrets that danced in the ears of the privileged few.

meanings.definition: Exclusives: A special deal or offer that is only available to a specific group of people.
meanings.sent1: The club offered exclusives to its loyal members every month.
meanings.sent2: The exclusives on the vacation package made it irresistible to book.
meanings.sent3: The exclusives were so tempting that even the pigeons seemed interested.
meanings.sent4: Her exclusives were like golden tickets hidden in a sea of ordinary offers.
meanings.sent5: The exclusives shone like beacons, guiding the chosen few to incredible savings.
